byline.contributor: Falih Hassan contributed reporting from Baghdad, and Alain Delaquérière contributed research from New York.
byline.original: By MICHAEL S. SCHMIDT and ERIC SCHMITT

abstract: Islamic State has begun using drones rigged with explosives to attack and kill enemies in Iraq; development presents new danger to Iraqi soldiers and others accustomed to surveillance drones and points to militants' success in adapting available technology for deadly means.

headline.print_headline: ISIS Is Piloting Simple Drones Rigged to Kill
headline.main: Pentagon Confronts a New Threat From ISIS: Exploding Drones

keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
keywords.name: organizations

keywords.value: United States Defense and Military Forces
keywords.name: subject

snippet: The group had been using surveillance drones, but a recent attack that killed two Kurdish fighters highlighted its success in developing an effective new weapon....
lead_paragraph: The group had been using surveillance drones, but a recent attack that killed two Kurdish fighters highlighted its success in developing an effective new weapon.
